page.title: 14EVENTS IN WATCHET
page.content:
{COURT LEET}- The earliest recorded Court Leet in Watchet was in 1620. This court is held every October to deal with matters of local importance. { {BLANKET DAY}- is a day before Christmas when all the people of Watchet get some money. It used to be a blanket but then it was changed to coal and now they get the money but it is still called blanket day. { {PANCAKE DAY RACE}- The race is held on Shrove Tuesday and people who want to enter the race have a frying pan and a pancake.They start the race at the top of the town and run to the Esplanade tossing the pancake while they run.
By Catherine Upstone and Paul Gallagher.
